text:
Your challenge is to create
three complete entrees
using these 18 ingredients.

Each ingredient must be used
once and only once
across the three dishes.

$20,000 on the line
in this challenge.

Whoa.
Ooh!

You have 40 minutes.
Get it? Got it? Go!

-Go, go, go!
-Okay, okay.

Nikki: Let's look at these
ingredients first.

Candace: Yeah, let's look.
Look, look, look, look.

Let's get three dishes out,
right? Bang, bang, bang.

Boom, boom, boom.
Here we go.

Let's go with the pork
on this one, right?

Let's get some mushrooms
going here.

So Chris, a.k.a. Geags,
is being super aggressive

with picking his ingredients,
and it's a little overwhelming.

Let's me and you
work on this one, alright?

I'm thinking of a mushroom
and chicken cream sauce.

With the collard greens,
I was gonna braise them down.

I'll focus on blackening
the chicken

and creating a nice sauce,
and I'll let Chris sauté

the vegetables
and make sure they're ready

for when we're ready
to bring everything together.

Where's the olive oil?
Olive oil?

I'm gonna make a nice little
sauce with the skirt steak.

Get a little Mexican.
-Mexican? Yeah, yeah, yeah.

Let's do avocado.
Yeah.

So, you want to just come
over here? Let's figure it out.

Okay, so I guess you and I
are gonna be it.

I guess we are.
Yeah.

So, what I was thinking
was maybe

like a fire-roasted
tomato sauce.

Okay, and then the chipotle
is gonna go in the marinade

for the skirt steak?
Right.

Okay, we can also make an
avocado guacamole kind of thing.

Okay, we have a hodgepodge
of junk right here.
Yeah.

So, what I was thinking
with this is like, you know,

pancetta, pork,
like a cherry brandy sauce.

How is this gonna
tie into that?

Yeah, I know.
This is throwing us off.

Nikki and I are left
with all the ingredients
that nobody wants.

He said he was gonna do
a chicken with a cream sauce.

So what if he takes the yogurt?
Want some yogurt?

I don't know if we're gonna do
a cream sauce. We'll see.

Alright.
That guy is shady.

Natasha:
How's his knife technique?
Look nice.

Oh là.
Oh, no. No.
[ Laughs ]

No. Oh là là.
No, no, no.
That took a bad turn.
[ Laughs ]

It's good, Perry.
What're you doing, Perry? Ca va?

What are you working on?
[ Loudly ] Ca va!

I'm making black garlic rice.
We're gonna sear the pork

in a cast iron,
on top of the bed of rice

with a little chutney
with cherries, pickles.

That's a lot
of flavors.

Cherries, pickles,
and black garlic.
Hell yeah!
Guys, just make sure

each dish need to have
six ingredients.

-We have seven.
-One, two, three, four.

Nikki: Alright,
who wants the pickles?
You'll use the pickles?

Are you gonna --
Before you jump on it, hold on.

No, no. I want you to have it.
It's a gift.
Everyone is suspicious.

Nikki and Perry
gave us the pickles.
They don't go with chicken,

and they certainly
don't go with this dish.

Ca va? You good?
Yeah.

This is a nice little
Cajun blend.

Are you putting the cream
in it, too?

I'm gonna make a cream sauce.
Yes.

Chris:
I'm using pine nuts.

You're doing a great job.
Thank you.

You know what the pine nut said
to the walnut?
I -- What?

We're both nuts.
Let's be friends.
Chris has a big mouth,

and it kind of raises
a red flag with me

because it might be him
hiding in plain sight
with how much noise he's making.

-Hey, Mark!
-Hmm?

-Who's better than me?
-Nobody.

Nobody. That's right.
You hear that, Nikki?
I heard it.
Chris drive me [bleep] nuts.

If he is the Rat,
maybe you would like him more

'cause he's just doing his job
as the Rat.

I hope he's the Rat.
[ Laughs ]
